title.narrative: CR MONITORING AND EVIDENCE GENERATION

description.narrative: By 2020 national capacity to reveal and monitor bottlenecks in realization of children's rights strengthened, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the national child rights monitoring system better serves knowledge and evidence generation, specifically on child vulnerabilities, for decision-making, and reporting and advocacy related to the Convention on the Rights of the Child

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 national capacity to reveal and monitor bottlenecks in realization of children?s rights strengthened

description.narrative: In 2020, the national capacity to report, use data and monitor SDGs was strengthened with MICS6 results successfully launched and the national platform for reporting on SDG achievements advanced. Monitoring of COVID-19&39;s impact on the well-being of families with children was enhanced through eight waves of longitudinal online surveys of families. Generated evidence considering both monetary and multidimensional child poverty informed the expansion of the Social Protection System in the form of targeted social assistance to families with many children. The study was selected as a finalist of the Best of UNICEF Research and Evaluation 2020 publication. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2020
